title: Gaspare Spontini
subtitle:
Gaspare Luigi Pacifico Spontini: 
An 18th century opera composer
description: The following story will explore the most significant points and events in the Italian composer Gaspare Spontini’s personal and professional life. In particular, it will focus on his biography, his occupations and fields of work, the awards he received during his life, where he worked and where he lived.

dynamic_elements.table_title: Gaspare Spontini, portrayed by Jean-Baptiste Aubry-Lecomte in the 19th century.

dynamic_elements.text:
Browsing through the MusicBO corpus, we discovered that Spontini worked in the same period of famous composer from the classical era like Auber, Meyerbeer, Rossini, Donizetti and Bellini in Paris.

"Paris and "Grand Opera" : Auber, Meyerbeer Spontini, Rossini, Donizetti and Bellini produced their best works in Paris where the musical movement in their life-time was more lively and more brilliant than anywhere else in Europe."

He was born in 1774 in Maiolati, which was at the time in the Papal State, now in the Province of Ancona. During his life, he spent most of his career abroad. He then returned to Italy and died in 1851 in Maiolati.

After studying at the conservatory in Naples, he then started working at some comedies in Italy. However, he spent most of his career life in Paris, where he started working at the Opéra becoming one of the greatest Italian composers of his age, admired by Cherubini, Beethoven, Weber and Rossini.

Because of the Bourbon Restoration, his works weren't considered as before, leading him to leave Paris for Berlin (at the time under the Kigndom of Prussia), where his operas had already achieved success, where he stayed until 1842.
He was a famous composer, conductor and musical director, mainly in the opera field, but also more generally in the music and conducting fields.

He was a member of the Académie des Beaux-Arts from June 15th 1839 to January 14th 1851. He replaced Ferdinando Paer, an Italian composer of German origins, and he was then replaced by Ambroise Thomas, a French composer particularly famous for his work Mignon﻿.

During his life, he received many awards. In particular the award "Pour le Mérite for Sciences and Arts order" which is given to scientists and artists who have made an outstanding name for themselves through the widespread recognition of their achievements in science or the arts.

The Gaspari Spontini Museum is located in Maiolata Spontini, in the house where the composer and his wife spent the last years of their lives. Inside, we can find some music sheets, manuscripts, two pianos and some paintings depicting the staging of Spontini's French works, like The Miltondel, The Vestal and others.
